intro: Phoradendron perrottetii var. curvifolium, commonly known as the curl-leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its waxy, leathery leaves that often curve at the edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Its berries are fleshy and serve as a food source for various birds and animals. This species is native to the southeastern United States and is often found in forested areas.
